meanings.definition: Treat (a sacred place or thing) with violent disrespect.
meanings.sent1: The vandals were desecrating the church by breaking the stained glass windows.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins were desecrated by graffiti artists.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids thought desecrating the library books was a funny prank.
meanings.sent4: His actions desecrated the memory of those who fought for freedom.
meanings.sent5: The act of desecrating a memorial is a dishonorable deed.

meanings.definition: Violate the sacred character of a place or language.
meanings.sent1: The developers desecrated the peaceful park by building a noisy factory.
meanings.sent2: The invaders desecrated the native language by imposing their own dialect.
meanings.sent3: It felt like desecrating the silence when the loud music blared in the library.
meanings.sent4: Her careless words desecrated the sanctity of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the historic building desecrated its cultural significance.
